Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to explore strategies for managing overwhelming feelings at work, particularly when faced with multiple deadlines.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been feeling overwhelmed with work due to multiple deadlines, and while they are trying to prioritize tasks, they still experience anxiety. They are also working on overcoming shyness in social situations.
Psychosocial History: The patient has been maintaining social connections, feeling included and part of the team during outings with co-workers.
Current Functional Status: The patient reports feeling more confident in social situations and has been actively engaging with co-workers.
Progress Evaluation: The patient has shown significant progress by practicing reframing techniques, which has helped them manage negative thoughts and build resilience.
Therapeutic Interventions: The plan includes exploring time management techniques like the Pomodoro Technique to help manage overwhelming feelings at work and reinforcing the importance of asking for help when needed.
Next Steps: The patient is encouraged to try the Pomodoro Technique and continue practicing reframing techniques while maintaining social connections.
